content.question: Suppose the variance in trunk diameter of the giant sequoia tree species is <math alttext="15.7 square meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>15.7</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext></mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>, while the variance in trunk diameter of the California redwood tree species is <math alttext="10.6 square meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10.6</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>. Let <math alttext="x bar sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the average trunk diameter of four randomly sampled giant sequoia trees, and let <math alttext="x bar sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> represent the average trunk diameter of three randomly sampled California redwood trees. If the random sampling is done with replacement, what is the standard deviation <math alttext="sigma sub, x bar sub 1 minus x bar sub 2, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>σ</mi></mrow><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> of the sampling distribution of the difference in sample means <math alttext="x bar sub 1 minus x bar sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the square root of the fraction 15.7 over 4, end fraction, minus the fraction 10.6 over 3, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>15.7</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>10.6</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the square root of 15.7 minus 10.6, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>15.7</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>10.6</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the square root of the fraction 15.7 over 4, end fraction, plus the fraction 10.6 over 3, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>15.7</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>10.6</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the square root of the fraction 15.7 over 4, end root, plus the square root of the fraction 10.6 over 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>15.7</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt><mo>+</mo><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>10.6</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 15.7 over 4, end fraction, plus the fraction 10.6 over 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>15.7</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>10.6</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the square root of the fraction 15.7 over 4, end fraction, plus the fraction 10.6 over 3, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>15.7</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>10.6</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 5.8: Sampling Distributions for Differences in Sample Means

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Determine parameters for probability distributions.
